episodeTitle: Clash with the Black Cat Pirates! The Great Battle on the Slope!
episodeTitleJapanese: 激突！クロネコ海賊団坂道の大攻防！
episodeTitleRomanized: Gekitotsu! Kuroneko Kaizoku-dan Sakamichi no Daikōbō!
description: The Straw Hats prepare to defend Syrup Village from the Black Cat Pirates, but they've set up their defense on the wrong beach. After realizing the pirates will arrive from the north, they race to intercept. Meanwhile, Kuro reveals his true identity to Merry and attacks him with his Cat Claws before heading to Kaya's mansion. Usopp and his crew fight to hold off the invading pirates while waiting for Luffy and Zoro to arrive.

events.title: Straw Hats Set Up Defense at Southern Coast
events.description: The Straw Hat Pirates, along with Usopp and his friends, prepare their defense at the southern beach entrance to Syrup Village. They spread oil on the slope to create a slippery trap for the incoming Black Cat Pirates, based on Usopp's assumption that this is where the pirates will arrive.
events.significance: Establishes the initial defensive strategy, though it's based on incorrect information. Shows the crew working together to protect the village.

events.title: Oil Trap Preparation Complete
events.description: The crew finishes spreading oil across the southern slope, creating a massive slippery trap. They're confident this will prevent the Black Cat Pirates from climbing up to the village and reaching Kaya's mansion.
events.significance: Demonstrates the crew's tactical planning and preparation, though their strategy will soon prove to be misdirected.

events.title: Discovery of the Mistake - Pirates Coming from the North
events.description: The crew realizes with horror that they've been defending the wrong beach. The Black Cat Pirates are actually approaching from the northern coast, not the south. Usopp's assumption about the only entrance was wrong, and the village has another access point.
events.significance: A crucial turning point that forces the crew to abandon their prepared defenses and race to the actual invasion point. Creates urgency and raises the stakes of the battle.

events.title: Kuro Reveals His True Identity to Merry
events.description: At Kaya's mansion, Klahadore drops his butler disguise and reveals himself to Merry as the infamous pirate Captain Kuro. Merry is shocked to discover that the trusted butler he's worked alongside has been deceiving them for three years. Kuro's calm demeanor breaks as he prepares to satisfy his killing instinct.
events.significance: A pivotal revelation that confirms Usopp's warnings were true. Merry witnesses firsthand the betrayal of someone they all trusted, validating the threat to Kaya and the village.

quotes.text: I thought I had killed him.
quotes.speaker: Kuro
quotes.context: Kuro's cold response when later asked about Merry's fate

events.title: Cat Claws Weapon Debut
events.description: Kuro reveals his signature weapon - the Cat Claws, a pair of black-furred gloves with full-length katana blades extending from each finger. The weapon's design resembles actual cat claws, giving Kuro devastating slashing power with both hands.
events.significance: First appearance of Kuro's primary weapon in the anime. The Cat Claws become iconic as Kuro's signature armament and demonstrate his deadly fighting style. The weapon's reveal emphasizes the serious threat Kuro poses.

events.title: Kuro Attacks Merry with Cat Claws
events.description: Unable to control his bloodlust any longer, Kuro slashes Merry with his Cat Claws, leaving the loyal butler in a pool of his own blood. Before collapsing, Merry desperately tries to warn Kaya to run, but his voice doesn't reach her in time. This brutal attack is Kuro's first violent act after dropping his peaceful butler facade.
events.significance: Marks the end of Kuro's three-year deception and his return to brutal piracy. Merry's attack serves as proof of the danger Kaya faces and demonstrates Kuro's ruthless nature. This moment eliminates any doubt about Kuro's villainy.

quotes.speaker: Merry
quotes.context: Merry's desperate warning to Kaya as he's struck down

events.title: Black Cat Pirates Arrive at Northern Coast
events.description: The Black Cat Pirates' ship arrives at the northern beach of Syrup Village, exactly as Kuro planned. The pirates begin disembarking and preparing to march up the northern slope toward the village and Kaya's mansion, unopposed due to the Straw Hats' misdirection.
events.significance: The invasion begins in earnest. The pirates' arrival at the undefended northern coast creates a race against time for Luffy and his crew to reach the correct location.

events.title: Usopp Arrives First at Northern Beach
events.description: Usopp, being the fastest runner and most familiar with the village's terrain, arrives at the northern slope ahead of Luffy and Zoro. He finds himself facing the entire Black Cat Pirates crew with only his Usopp Pirates (Ninjin, Piiman, and Tamanegi) as backup. Despite being outnumbered, Usopp prepares to defend his village.
events.significance: Demonstrates Usopp's bravery as he faces overwhelming odds to protect his home. This moment is crucial for his character development, showing he can back up his tall tales with real courage when it matters most.

events.title: Makibishi Jigoku (Caltrop Hell) Debut
events.description: Usopp deploys his Makibishi Jigoku technique for the first time, scattering sharp caltrops across the slope to slow down and injure the advancing Black Cat Pirates. The painful caltrops pierce the feet of pirates attempting to charge up the hill, creating an effective defensive barrier.
events.significance: First appearance of one of Usopp's signature defensive techniques. Shows his tactical thinking and resourcefulness in combat. The caltrops become a recurring tool in Usopp's arsenal throughout the series.

events.title: Namari Boshi (Lead Star) Debut
events.description: Usopp uses his slingshot to fire lead pellets at the Black Cat Pirates, striking down multiple advancing enemies with precise shots. This Namari Boshi technique demonstrates his exceptional marksmanship and ability to hit targets from long range.
events.significance: Introduces Usopp's signature offensive technique and showcases his skills as a sniper. This ability becomes fundamental to his role in future battles and establishes him as a long-range combatant.

events.title: Usopp Pirates Join the Defense
events.description: Ninjin, Piiman, and Tamanegi fight alongside Usopp despite their fear, using wooden swords and slingshots to help fend off the Black Cat Pirates. Though they're just children facing hardened pirates, their loyalty to Usopp and their village gives them courage.
events.significance: Shows the bond between Usopp and his young followers. Their bravery in the face of real danger demonstrates the influence Usopp has had on them, even though his stories were usually exaggerated.

events.title: Luffy and Zoro Arrive at the Northern Beach
events.description: After racing across the island, Luffy and Zoro finally arrive at the northern coast to find Usopp and his crew desperately fighting the Black Cat Pirates. Their arrival turns the tide of battle, as the Straw Hat Pirates' strongest fighters are now in position to face the invasion.
events.significance: Marks the true beginning of the major battle. With Luffy and Zoro on the scene, the Straw Hats can mount a proper defense against Kuro's crew. Relieves the pressure on Usopp who was fighting alone.

events.title: The Great Battle on the Slope Begins
events.description: With all combatants now in position, the full-scale battle between the Straw Hat Pirates and the Black Cat Pirates begins on the northern slope. Luffy, Zoro, and Usopp prepare to face off against Jango and the Black Cat Pirates crew to protect Kaya and Syrup Village.
events.significance: Escalates the conflict into a major battle sequence. Sets up the confrontations that will continue through the next several episodes, including eventual encounters with the Nyaban Brothers and Captain Kuro himself.

quotes.speaker: Merry
quotes.context: Merry's desperate warning to Kaya as he's struck down by Kuro

quotes.speaker: Kuro
quotes.context: Kuro's cold response when asked about Merry's fate

themes.theme: Courage in the Face of Overwhelming Odds
themes.description: Usopp and his young crew face the entire Black Cat Pirates despite being vastly outnumbered and outmatched. Their willingness to stand and fight demonstrates true courage, not the absence of fear but action despite it.
themes.symbolism: The slope represents the uphill battle Usopp faces, both literally and metaphorically, in protecting his village and proving his worth.

themes.description: Kuro's three-year deception comes to a violent end as he reveals his true nature to Merry. The trusted butler becomes a ruthless killer, showing how appearances can be deceiving and how trust can be weaponized.
themes.symbolism: The Cat Claws represent Kuro's hidden danger - the claws beneath the gloves, the killer beneath the butler's facade.

themes.description: The Straw Hats' carefully prepared defense becomes useless when they discover they're at the wrong location. The episode shows that even the best plans must adapt to changing circumstances, and quick thinking is as important as preparation.
themes.symbolism: The oil-slicked southern slope represents wasted preparation, while the northern slope represents the need for improvisation.

themes.description: Usopp fights not for glory or adventure, but to protect his village, his friends, and Kaya. This personal stake drives him to face impossible odds with determination.
themes.symbolism: The village slope serves as the literal last line of defense between the invaders and the innocent people of Syrup Village.

characterSpotlights.development: Usopp demonstrates real courage by facing the Black Cat Pirates alone when his friends haven't arrived yet. He uses his Makibishi Jigoku and Namari Boshi techniques for the first time, showing his growth as a combatant. This episode marks a turning point where Usopp backs up his boasts with genuine heroism.
keyActions: Arrives first at the northern coast
Deploys Makibishi Jigoku to slow the pirates
Uses Namari Boshi to strike down advancing enemies
Holds the line until Luffy and Zoro arrive
Commands his Usopp Pirates in battle

characterSpotlights.development: Kuro drops his butler disguise completely, revealing his true nature to Merry before attacking him. His use of the Cat Claws demonstrates his return to his violent pirate ways. The episode shows his cold, calculating nature and his inability to fully suppress his bloodlust.
keyActions: Reveals his true identity to Merry
Heads toward Kaya's room to complete his plan
quotes: I thought I had killed him.

characterSpotlights.development: Merry discovers the truth about Klahadore being Captain Kuro, validating Usopp's warnings. Despite being attacked and severely wounded, his final act is attempting to warn Kaya, showing his loyalty to her above his own safety.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy races to reach the northern coast after realizing their strategic error. His arrival provides crucial reinforcement for Usopp and signals the start of the true battle.

Races across the island to reach northern coast

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends the preparation sequences and the oil trap setup more than the manga, adding more character interaction moments during the defensive preparations.
The 4Kids dub combined episodes 11 and 12 into a single episode titled 'The War at the Shore,' significantly condensing the pacing.

trivia.fact: This episode marks the first appearance of Kuro's signature Cat Claws weapon in the anime, which become one of the most memorable weapons from the East Blue Saga.
The Makibishi Jigoku (Caltrop Hell) technique debuts in this episode and becomes one of Usopp's most frequently used tactical weapons throughout the series.
Episode 12 was directed by Junichi Fujise with animation direction by Takeo Ide, maintaining the consistent quality of the early East Blue episodes.
The 4Kids English dub titled this episode 'The War at the Shore' and combined it with Episode 11, changing the pacing of the Syrup Village arc significantly.
This episode adapts material from manga chapters 28-30, maintaining the anime's pace of roughly 1.5-2 chapters per episode during the East Blue Saga.
Merry's lamb-like appearance is a visual pun on his role as butler - the Japanese word for butler (執事, shitsuji) sounds similar to sheep (羊, hitsuji).
